author: Griselda Flores
title: Which Latin Artist Should Perform During a Super Bowl Halftime Show? Vote!
text:
Mike Windle/Getty Images for iHeartMedia Ricky Martin performsÂ at the iHeartRadio Theater Los Angeles on Feb. 10, 2015 in Burbank, Calif. 
With the Super Bowl just around the corner, we couldn't help but think of a few Latin artists we'd love to see perform on the halftime stage. 
For some, including Shakira , Pitbull and Jennifer Lopez , it wouldn't be the first time they performed in front of a massive crowd during a sports event. All three acts performed during the World Cup. 
Mr. 305 and J.Lo sang the official 2014 World Cup track "We Are One (Ole Ola)" at the opening ceremony in Brazil, while Shak performed at the closing concert singing "La La La." In 2010, the Colombian singer performed "Waka Waka" in South Africa. 
And since Super Bowl halftime performers are known to bring out special friends to join them onstage -- last year Coldplay brought out BeyoncĂŠ and Bruno Mars and the year before that Katy Perry featured Missy Elliott and Lenny Kravitz -- the possibilities of who these Latin superstars would invite are endless. 
Ricky Martin and Fat Joe or Christina Aguilera . Shakira with Maluma and/or Rihanna. Daddy Yankee featuring Snoop Dogg and Fergie -- just to point out a few collabs that can potentially happen on the stage. 
Below, vote for which Latin artist you'd want to see perform at the Super Bowl. If your top choice isn't on the poll, add your personal favorite in the space provided.
